help.title: **Help**
help.description: All commands below come with a description of what the command does and any available subcommands.

footer.text: To get additional help for a specific command, run "help <command>".

fields.name: init
fields.value: Initialises the guild calendar with a specific timezone.

fields.name: event
fields.value:
Create, update and delete calendar events.
Available subcommands: `list`, `update`, `delete`

fields.name: perms
fields.value:
Set role- or user-specific command permissions.
Available subcommands: `nodes`, `show`

fields.name: prefix
fields.value: View or change the bot's current prefix for your guild.

fields.name: info
fields.value: Get some information about the bot.

fields.name: Need more help? Did you find an issue with the bot?
fields.value: Run the `support` command to get an invite link to the support server and get in touch with the developer.

fields.name: Want to add the bot to your own server?
fields.value: Run the `invite` command to get an invite link for the bot.

init.title: **Help**: init
init.description:
Use this command to initialise the guild calendar with a specific timezone.
You **must** run this command first before you are allowed to create events.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage
fields.value:
`init <timezone>`
- `timezone` A timezone name from the tz database. See https://goo.gl/NzNMon under the TZ column for a list of valid timezones.

event.title: **Help**: event
event.description: Create, update and delete events for your guild. The bot will notify you automatically when the event is about to start.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage: Creating events
fields.value:
`event <event details> [--desc <event description>]`
- `event details` The details for your event. Simply type the details as how you would say it. For example, you can type `CS:GO Scrims at 7pm tomorrow` or `Game Reveal Livestream from 9am to 11am next Thursday`.
- `event description` An optional description for your event.

fields.name: Usage: Updating events
fields.value:
`event update <event number> [<event details> | --desc <event description>]`
- `event number` The number of the event that you want to update, which you can check with the `event list` command.
- `event details` The details for your event. Simply type the details as how you would say it. For example, you can type `CS:GO Scrims at 7pm tomorrow` or `Game Reveal Livestream from 9am to 11am next Thursday`.
- `event description` An optional description for your event.

fields.name: Usage: Deleting events
fields.value:
`event delete <event number>`
- `event number` The number of the event that you want to update, which you can check with the `event list` command.

perms.title: **Help**: perms
perms.description: Set command usage permissions for certain roles or users to limit command usage.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage: Modifying permissions
fields.value:
`perms <allow | deny> <permNode> [--role <role> | --user <user>]`
- `allow | deny` Allow or deny the specified permission node.
- `permNode` The permission node you want to modify. Run `perms nodes` for a list of nodes.
- `role` The role that you want to modify the permission for.
- `user` The user that you want to modify the permission for.

fields.name: Usage: Showing current permissions
fields.value:
`perms show [--node <permNode> | --role <role> | --user <user>]`
- `permNode` The permission node that you want to show permissions for.
- `role` The role that you want to show permissions for.
- `user` The user that you want to show permissions for.

prefix.title: **Help**: prefix
prefix.description: View or set the bot's prefix for your guild.

footer.text: Syntax: <> = required field, [] = optional field, | = select one. You're not supposed to type these characters in the actual command.

fields.name: Usage
fields.value:
`prefix [new prefix]`
- `new prefix` The new prefix that you want to set for the bot.
